intro: Hebestigma cubense var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf hebestigma, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Cuba. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lanceolate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a distinctive inflorescence structure. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
